docs.text: Hackmyresume Hackmyresume and a handful of themes for quick use Hackmyresume allows you to generate multiple output formats using different themes. Please see HackMyResume for all other things you can do with this application. All installed themes are located under: /usr/lib/node_modules, the default theme is jsonresume-theme-eloquent. Mount the folder where your resume.json file resides as a volume to /resumes. Quick Start ¶ docker run --rm --name hackmyresume \ -v ${PWD}:/resumes \ jsloan117/hackmyresume:latest
docs.title: Home

docs.text: If you used your current working directory then you should find your resumes there or within a volume. ls -lh ${PWD} total 904K -rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 0 Feb 19 15:47 resume.json -rw-r--r-- 1 root root 795K Feb 19 15:48 resume.pdf -rw-r--r-- 1 root root 107K Feb 19 15:48 resume.pdf.html

docs.title: Preinstalled themes

docs.text: The image is available from the Docker registry and this is the simplest way to get it. To run the image use this command: docker run --rm --name hackmyresume \ -v ${PWD}:/resumes \ jsloan117/hackmyresume:latest --help docker run --rm --name hackmyresume \ -v ${PWD}:/resumes \ jsloan117/hackmyresume:latest build /resumes/resume.json /resumes/resume.pdf \ -t /usr/lib/node_modules/jsonresume-theme-stackoverflow
docs.title: Run from Docker registry

docs.text: Use theme not installed docker run --rm --entrypoint="" --name hackmyresume \ -v ${PWD}:/resumes \ jsloan117/hackmyresume:latest /bin/bash -c 'npm install -g jsonresume-theme-flat && hackmyresume build /resumes/resume.json /resumes/resume.pdf -t /usr/lib/node_modules/jsonresume-theme-flat'
